definitions.title: terr.
definitions.body: (Egypt. Kōš, Steindorff:BAS i, 593, As. Kûsu, Id:ib. Dl:Pa 251; Kaši in Tel Amarna tablets, vid. Wkl Tel Am 39*);—
1st ‘son’ of [[חָם]] Ge 10:6, Ge 10:7 (P) = 1Ch 1:8, 1Ch 1:9, LXX Xouv, Vulgate Chus, from whom descended acc. to these vv. the southernmost peoples known to Hebrews.
land and people of southern Nile-valley, or Upper Egypt, extending from Syene (Ez Eze 29:10) indefinitely to the south, LXX Aiqiopia, Aiqiopev:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: the land Is 11:11, Is 18:1, Zep 3:10, Ez Eze 29:10, Job 28:19, Es 1:1, Es 8:9.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: the people Is 20:4, Je 46:9, Ez Eze 38:5; personif. Ps 68:32.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: indeterminate, either land or people, or including both: Is 20:3, Is 20:5, Is 43:3, Is 45:14, 2Ki 19:9 = Is 37:9, Na 3:9, Ez Eze 30:4, Eze 30:5, Eze 30:9, Ps 87:4 (LXX lao\v Aiqiopwn).

in Ge 10:8 (J) = 1Ch 1:10 [[כּוּשׁ]] is err. for [[כַּשׁ]] = Bab. Kašsšu, acc. to Schr:COT on Ge 10:6, Dl:Pa 51 ff. 72 f. and most Assyriol.; so perh. also Ge 2:13 (J), yet v. Hpt: Über Ld. u. Meer, 1894–5, No. 15.
